bug.short_desc: Need support for Oracle PLSQL in opengrok

long_desc.thetext:
This enhancement request is in continuation with the mail communication we had with "Lubo≈°", "vladimir" and "Michal".
We are using the opengrok for our product code. Almost 50% of our code is in plsql. We badly need support for plsql in opengrok. Can you please review and do the needful.
The plsql constructs are explained well in the following links.
http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E11882_01/appdev.112/e25519/sqlstatements.htm#CIHBEABD. This oracle document explains the constructs used in a typical stored plsql units. Most of the time we will be using the "CREATE [OR REPLACE]" Statements. We do not use the ALTER and DROP statements.
http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E11882_01/appdev.112/e25519/toc.htm. This document explains the plsql fundamentals. "PL/SQL Data Types", "PL/SQL Control Statements", "PL/SQL Subprograms", "PL/SQL Triggers", "PL/SQL Language Elements" and "PL/SQL Name Resolution" are some important sections.
Checked in google and found some more links. http://www.antlr.org/grammar/list. ANTLR seem to hosting set of grammers for different languages. https://github.com/porcelli/plsql-parser. This link provides the plsql grammer as per "ANTLR". The link http://www.ibrezina.net/OracleSQL.tgz seem to have the latest grammer for SQL
Having plsql support will help us in leveraging this tool to a great extend. Please review the links and let me know if you need any more details.
Thanks, Raja
